title: What are the dangers and controversies surrounding the practice of magnetism and hypnotism in medicine?
first_phrase: In this text, the author explores the history and controversy surrounding the practice of magnetism and hypnosis. In the last 200 tokens, the author addresses the alleged dangers of magnetism and how doctors have attempted to monopolize it. The author criticizes this approach but acknowledges the existence of certain risks, such as abusing subjects while in a state of hypnosis and making them carry out reprehensible acts. However, the author argues that such dangers are not exclusive to magnetism or hypnosis and that these practices, when properly handled, can be safe. The author cites the opinion of Dr. Bernheim from the University of Nancy, who claims that hypnosis is safe when handled properly.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the notion that hypnotism and magnetism pose significant dangers to individuals is largely exaggerated and unfounded. While there may be some risks associated with these practices, when properly used, they offer numerous benefits and pose no significant threat to those who undergo them. It is important to remember that many of these fears are born out of competition between different groups of practitioners, and that the vast majority of those who use hypnotism and magnetism do so with the utmost care and expertise.
